at.pwd.boardgame.game.mancala

Class MancalaGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.pwd.boardgame.game.mancala.MancalaGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Game<MancalaState,MancalaBoard>

    public class MancalaGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements Game<MancalaState,MancalaBoard>
    MancalaGame is an implementation of the Game interface for Mancala. Keep in mind that MancalaGame does not check for "valid" moves. Every move that is done is immediately executed. MancalaGames state is in the MancalaState object and the board configuration in the MancalaBoard.

      • MancalaGame

      • MancalaGame

        public MancalaGame(MancalaState state,
                   MancalaBoard board)
        Creates a new MancalaGame
        Parameters:
        state - If null the default MancalaState of the board is generated (placing stones_per_slot many stones on each slot). If not null the given state is used.
        board - The board that should be used for this MancalaGame

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init()
        Registers MancalaGame to the GameFactory and initializes MancalaHumanAgent

      • getViewXml

        public java.io.InputStream getViewXml()
        Description copied from interface: Game
        Returns the view as an FXML inputstream. This generates the board for the BoardController
        Specified by:
        getViewXml in interface Game<MancalaState,MancalaBoard>
        Returns:
        The inputstream of the fxml file

      • loadBoard

        public void loadBoard(java.io.InputStream boardStream)
        Description copied from interface: Game
        This is called at the beginning loading the board. This should initialize the Game. After this getState() and getBoard() should return non null values. When an error happens during loading a RuntimeException may be thrown.
        Specified by:
        loadBoard in interface Game<MancalaState,MancalaBoard>
        Parameters:
        boardStream - InputStream of the board XML

      • selectSlot

        public boolean selectSlot(java.lang.String id)
        Selects the slot with the given ID and calculates the turn. If this ends the game. The final stones of the enemys player are placed in his depot too. Throws a RuntimeException if an invalid slot is selected
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the slot that has been selected
        Returns:
        true ... the current player can play another turn, false ... the current player has to end his turn

      • getSelectableSlots

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSelectableSlots()
        Returns a list of selectable slots for the current game state and current board
        Returns:
        A List containing all selectable slot IDs. If there is nothing selectable the list is empty

      • checkIfPlayerWins

        public WinState checkIfPlayerWins()
        Checks if a player is winning. If a player is winning the opponent gets the remaining stones into his own depot (so this method also alters the state).
        Returns:
        A WinState describing if and who is winning

      • getBoard

        public MancalaBoard getBoard()
        Description copied from interface: Game
        Returns the board configuration of the current game.
        Specified by:
        getBoard in interface Game<MancalaState,MancalaBoard>
        Returns:
        Some object implementing Board interface

      • nextPlayer

        public int nextPlayer()
        Description copied from interface: Game
        Finishes the current players turn and starting the turn of the next player. Keep in mind, that the Game class does not check for valid moves. Always call methods according to the rules.
        Specified by:
        nextPlayer in interface Game<MancalaState,MancalaBoard>
        Returns:
        The next players ID
